pullRequest.body:
Provide the definition of the Schnirelmann density, basic properties of it, and some simple useful calculations.

Co-authored-by: YaÃ«l Dillies <yael.dillies@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Doga Can Sertbas <dogacan.sertbas@gmail.com>

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7192358506/job/19588647614)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7192358506/job/19588648407)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7192358506/job/19588647885)
A few uses of the new tactic `gcongr`, optional of course.  To use them you will need to mark `Finset.card_le_of_subset` with `@[gcongr]`, but that should be done in any case.

```suggestion
  gcongr
  rw [âNat.cast_pred hk', Nat.cast_le]
  calc _ â¤ card (Ioo 0 k) := ?_
    _ = _ := by simp
  gcongr
```
(the second `gcongr` is probably useful only if you are in the mood to write more of this argument as a `calc`)

I originally tried many of these already, but they made the file slower to compile for me, and makes the proofs significantly more brittle, so I'm very hesitant to put them in (just like nonterminal `simp`s)! Thanks for the suggestions, however.

Interesting, we could try to get data here ... in the mean time the equivalent of `simp only` would be to use patterns, `gcongr ?_ / _` and `gcongr card ?_`.  More worthwhile when you haven't already looked up the lemmas though.

In particular, I intended `gcongr` (like `congr`) to be a mid-proof (rather than finishing) tactic more often than not, so if there is evidence of a slowdown, we have work to do.  I'm less worried about brittleness -- such changes ought to be easy to repair.

Ah the use of patterns would be nice, although as you say I already knew where these lemmas were! 
I'm not so sure they're easy to repair - particularly in the case where a congruence lemma is applied which goes too far, and it can be hard to figure out which step was unhelpful when repairing. Using patterns would help with this though!

```suggestion
  ciInf_mono â¨0, fun _ â¨_, hxâ© => hx â¸ by positivityâ© fun _ => by
    gcongr; exact monotone_filter_right _ h
```
This is a particular example I'm worried about when it comes to non-terminal `gcongr` - where adding new things to `gcongr`could produce errors here...

```suggestion
  refine (Nat.lt_floor_add_one _).trans_le' ?_
  gcongr
  simp [subset_iff]
```

```suggestion
  Â· gcongr
```

```suggestion
## References

```

```suggestion
Note this cannot be improved to `âá¶  n : â in at_top`, as can be seen by `A = {1}á¶`.
```
right?
Also, `at_top` should be `atTop`.
Thanks both!
Maybe better written using `Nat.ModEq`? Then it's also true for `m = 1`.
I added the ModEq version as well, but kept this version since I think both can be useful.

```suggestion
    schnirelmannDensity {n | n % m = 1} = mâ»Â¹ := by
```

```suggestion
    schnirelmannDensity A â¤ 1 - kâ»Â¹ := by
```

